property.name: Rules
property.value: Each player sacrifices all colored permanents he or she controls.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The emergence of the Eldrazi isn't necessarily a bad thing, as long as you've already lived a fulfilling and complete life without regrets." —Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you cast Artisan of Kozilek, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Annihilator 2 (Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices two permanents.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: Emrakul, the Aeons Torn can't be countered. When you cast Emrakul, take an extra turn after this one. Flying, protection from colored spells, annihilator 6 When Emrakul is put into a graveyard from anywhere, its owner shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

property.name: Rules
property.value: +4: Target player exiles a card from his or her hand. −3: Exile target permanent. −14: Restart the game, leaving in exile all non-Aura permanent cards exiled with Karn Liberated. Then put those cards onto the battlefield under your control.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you cast Kozilek, Butcher of Truth, draw four cards. Annihilator 4 (Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices four permanents.) When Kozilek is put into a graveyard from anywhere, its owner shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you cast Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre, destroy target permanent. Indestructible Annihilator 4 (Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices four permanents.) When Ulamog is put into a graveyard from anywhere, its owner shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Annihilator 2 (Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices two permanents.) Ulamog's Crusher attacks each turn if able.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Whatever the Eldrazi's purpose is, it has nothing to do with something so insignificant as us." —Nirthu, lone missionary

property.name: Rules
property.value: (ĝ can be paid with either @ or 2 life.) Target artifact or creature you control gains protection from artifacts or from the color of your choice until end of turn.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Bladehold houses a rogues' gallery filled with the living "statues" of the worst enemies of the Auriok.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.) Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, it gains lifelink until end of turn.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Exile target black or red permanent.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "They say only the good die young. Obviously, you are one of the exceptions." —Delrobah, cleric of Ivora Gate

property.name: Rules
property.value: Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for 1 or one mana of that creature's color.) When Conclave Phalanx enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each creature you control.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Court Homunculus gets +1/+1 as long as you control another artifact.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Mages of Esper measure their wealth and status by the number of servants in their retinues.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant creature with another Aura attached to it Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has first strike, vigilance, and lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Let the deception of the gods yield to the pure light of day." —Brimaz, king of Oreskos

property.name: Rules
property.value: Tap target creature. Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, exile that creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Venser wondered if it could still be called a teleportation spell if the destination is oblivion.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Vigilance Other creatures you control get +2/+2. Creatures your opponents control get -2/-2.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The Gitaxians whisper among themselves of other worlds. If they exist, we must bring Phyrexia's magnificence to them."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Choose one — • Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn. • Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Where metal is tainted and wood is scarce, we are best armed by faith." —Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may exile Hikari, Twilight Guardian. If you do, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying Metalcraft — Artifacts you control have shroud as long as you control three or more artifacts. (An artifact with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Every sword drawn to defend is an angelic blade, guided to justice by an angelic hand." —Auriok proverb

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying As Iona, Shield of Emeria enters the battlefield, choose a color. Your opponents can't cast spells of the chosen color.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: No more shall the righteous cower before evil.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sacrifice Kami of Ancient Law: Destroy target enchantment.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Duty and law are the foundation on which civilization stands. They must not fall, for when they do, they take everything with them." —Lord Konda

property.name: Rules
property.value: As long as Kor Duelist is equipped, it has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Swords cannot reach far enough. Chains cannot strike hard enough. An eternal dilemma, but a simple one."

property.name: Rules
property.value: If Leyline of Sanctity is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield. You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The southern fortress taken by invaders? Heh, sure . . . when elephants fly." —Brezard Skeinbow, captain of the guard

property.name: Rules
property.value: Double strike, protection from black and from green

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A symbol of what Mirrodin once was and hope for what it will be again.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.) X: Until end of turn, creatures you control have base power and toughness X/X and gain all creature types.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sacrifice Moonlit Strider: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn. Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may pay 1. If you do, put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Auriok see the artificer as a conduit, beckoning new creations into the world.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent. When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Exile target creature. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The landscape shimmered and I felt a chill breeze. When my vision cleared, I found myself alone among the corpses of my fallen friends." —Journal found in Numai

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Like blinking or breathing, responding to an alarm is an involuntary reflex.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Like dawn's first light, blind the unprepared and banish the shadows." —Skyhunter creed

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I need never remember my past associates, my victims, my mistakes. Innistrad preserves them all for me." —Sorin Markov

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sunlance deals 3 damage to target nonwhite creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It's easy for the innocent to speak of justice. They seldom feel its terrible power." —Orim, Samite inquisitor

property.name: Rules
property.value: As long as Sunspear Shikari is equipped, it has first strike and lifelink.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Left without their leader Raksha, the leonin split into two prides: one side supported the regent kha, while the other rebelled in fury.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Taj-Nar Swordsmith enters the battlefield, you may pay X. If you do, search your library for an Equipment card with converted mana cost X or less and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The jeweler, the potter, the smith . . . They all imbue a bit of their souls into their creations. The kami destroy that crafted mortal shell and absorb the soul within." —Noboru, master kitemaker

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Waxmane Baku. 1, Remove X ki counters from Waxmane Baku: Tap X target creatures.

property.value: Flying 2#: Tap target creature with flying.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Wind is forceful, yet ephemeral. It can knock a dragon out of the sky, yet pass through the smallest crack unhindered." —Jestus Dreya, Of Elements and Eternity

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying Metalcraft — #: Exile Argent Sphinx. Return it to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only if you control three or more artifacts.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A great mirage, a dream of wings and silver.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The sky teems with just as much life as the forest or the deep seas." —Hadi Kasten, Calla Dale naturalist

property.value: Choose two — • Counter target spell. • Return target permanent to its owner's hand. • Tap all creatures your opponents control. • Draw a card.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying When Faerie Mechanist enters the battlefield, look at the top three cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Counter target red or green spell.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Your downfall was not your ignorance, your weakness, or your hubris, but your warm blood." —Heidar, Rimewind master

property.name: Rules
property.value: Guile can't be blocked except by three or more creatures. If a spell or ability you control would counter a spell, instead exile that spell and you may play that card without paying its mana cost. When Guile is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

property.value: Graft 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.) 1: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains flying until end of turn.

property.value: Return all artifacts target player owns to his or her hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Hurkyl's research at the College of Lat-Nam wasn't enough to stop the two brothers, but for centuries thereafter her spellcraft taught artificers restraint.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you cast a spell, proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "See how gratefully this world accepts our blessings." —Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

property.name: Rules
property.value: Counter target spell unless its controller pays 3.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It's so cute when it's sleeping, isn't it? Actually, it's still as abhorrent as ever, but at least it's not trying to kill us." —Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

property.value: Graft 4 (This creature enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.) 1, Remove two +1/+1 counters from among creatures you control: Draw a card.

property.value: Even the clouds bend themselves to Memnarch's will, eager to swallow those who oppose him.

property.value: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it into its owner's hand instead of into that player's graveyard. Draw a card.

property.value: For the Azorius, the law can be a physical shield against chaos and anarchy.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Your deed cannot be undone. You, however, can be." —Agosto, Azorius imperator

property.value: The vedalken interrogate all intruders—once the hoverguards are done with them.

property.value: Proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.) Draw a card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "More of that strange oil . . . It's probably nothing."

property.value: Metalcraft — Stoic Rebuttal costs 1 less to cast if you control three or more artifacts. Counter target spell.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Obsessed with the pursuit of knowledge above all else, vedalken can appear to be cold and emotionless.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand, one on top of your library, and one on the bottom of your library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Mastery is achieved when "telling time" becomes "telling time what to do."

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Vedalken eyes don't see the beauty in things. They see only what those things can teach.

property.value: #: Water Servant gets +1/-1 until end of turn. #: Water Servant gets -1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life and put a 1/1 black Faerie Rogue creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: In Lorwyn's brief evenings, the sun pauses at the horizon long enough for a certain species of violet to bloom with the fragrance of mischief.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sacrifice a creature: Bloodthrone Vampire gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Some humans willingly offered up their blood, hoping it would grant the vampire families the strength to stave off the Eldrazi.

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to cast Bone Splinters, sacrifice a creature. Destroy target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Witches of the Split-Eye Coven speak of a future when Grixis will overflow with life energy. For now, they must harvest vis from the living to fuel their dark magics.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Simic use the claws as scalpels, while the Rakdos use them for tattooing and torture. The Gruul use them to pick their teeth after lunching on the rest of the carcass.

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Takenuma was filled with a chorus of moans, shrieks, and wails. Some came from the living, some from the dying, and some, most horribly, from the dead.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Destroy target green or white creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: There are few ways to escape the deathmark: bargaining with a demon, washing in the fabled waters of youth, and of course, death.

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to cast Devouring Greed, you may sacrifice any number of Spirits. Target player loses 2 life plus 2 life for each Spirit sacrificed this way. You gain that much life.

property.value: (ĝ can be paid with either $ or 2 life.) Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "You serve Phyrexia. Your pieces would better serve Phyrexia elsewhere." —Azax-Azog, the Demon Thane

property.value: When Dread Drone enters the battlefield, put two 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature tokens onto the battlefield. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add 1 to your mana pool."

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Each Eldrazi ancient spawned a lineage of horrors in unfathomable shapes.

property.value: Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.) Flying

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The swamps go silent at its approach, but it still hears the heartbeat of the prey within.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you cast a creature spell, put X 1/1 black Thrull creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is that spell's converted mana cost. When you control seven or more Thrulls, sacrifice Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder.

property.value: In desolate places, changelings may take the shape of fancies, or memories, or fears.

property.value: Even the small wounds let hope bleed out.

property.value: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. Draw a card.

property.value: "The results of our ninth inoculation were the same. The specimen was, of course, euthanized before the contagion could spread." —Vedalken research notes

property.value: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.) At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on each nonblack creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Many have heard the beginning of its low, sustained shriek but few the end.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Though you may see the same bones, you'll never see the same skeleton twice.

property.value: Dragons consider drakes to be mockeries of their perfection, destroying them on sight.

property.value: "Have you ever killed insects nibbling at your crops? I think that's what the Eldrazi believe they're doing to us." —Sheyda, Ondu gamekeeper

property.name: Flavor
property.value: His sickle was forged in the heat of another cinder's funeral pyre.

property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life unless an opponent has 10 or less life.

property.value: The lacerators cut themselves before each hunt. They must feed before the sun rises or bleed to death.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Some vampires reject the decadent trappings of their kind. Once they turn feral, no amount of blood will satisfy their hunger.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Once each year, the oni and other evil spirits paraded through villages to disturb mortals' sleep. During the war, this parade became a nightly event." —Observations of the Kami War

property.name: Rules
property.value: Banefire deals X damage to target creature or player. If X is 5 or more, Banefire can't be countered by spells or abilities and the damage can't be prevented.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: For Sarkhan Vol, the dragon is the purest expression of life's savage splendor.

property.value: Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.) Up to two target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain all creature types until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The changing kind suffers as we do. We must join as one to quench our tyrants!"

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Ogres taunt the dragons by moving into their territory, but even the hellkites find them too much trouble to hunt." —Marza, mountain scout

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Just think how strong I'll be if my arms don't tear off!"

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Blood, bone, and sinew are magnified, as is the rage that drives them. The brain, however, remains unchanged—a little bean, swinging by a strand in a cavernous, raving head.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Kicker 4 (You may pay an additional 4 as you cast this spell.) Burst Lightning deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If Burst Lightning was kicked, it deals 4 damage to that creature or player instead.

property.name: Rules
property.value: First strike @#$%^: Until end of turn, Dragonsoul Knight becomes a Dragon, gets +5/+3, and gains flying and trample.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The farther he roamed from Jund and its dragons, the more he felt their essence in himself.
